column4: how do i get dhcp to work with my wireless? "wireless tools for linux" can scan all AP's including my own but i dont seem to be able to get dhcp from it
iwscan finds my ap and iwconfig sets my ap and all that everything is fine, but dhclient just cant find dhcp
and i have no idea why
can you look at the AP, the log should tell if you connected
the AP log, you will need to connect to it's admin interface
well i cant get to the AP log when i'm in ubuntu because i dont have internet in ubuntu lol
thught you may have another way in.
well i dont remember being a log there
tail dmesg or tail -f /var/log/messages to see what your connection is doing
my linksys and dlink have logs. not real detailed and not always helpful
omg i think i know what the problem is
it says DHCP to my dads, moms and sis pc but to me it says reserved
ah ha!  most problems should be that simple
